text: There have been 60 women in the United States Senate since it started in 1789. Rebecca Felton was the first. She was in the Senate for one day in 1922. Hattie Caraway was the first woman elected to the Senate in 1932. As of October 3, 2023, there are 25 women Senators out of 100. The largest number of women Senators at one time was 26, in 2020 and 2021. ==Women in the Senate now (as of 2023)== Class State Name Party Prior experience First took office Born 3 Alabama Katie Britt Republican CEO of the Business Council of Alabama, chief of staff to predecessor Richard Shelby 2023 1982 3 Alaska Lisa Murkowski Republican Alaska House of Representatives 2002 1957 1 Arizona Kyrsten Sinema IndependentSinema was elected as a Democrat in 2018, but switched to an independent in December 2022.
